title: Hill Of Tara Walk Route

images.title: The former St Patrick's Parish Church (CoI) at Tara by Eric Jones, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The former St Patrick's Parish Church (CoI) at Tara

images.title: August Schwerdfeger, CC BY 4.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Mound of the Hostages, Hill of Tara. The evocative seat of Ireland's Celtic kings. Tara consists of numerous monuments and earthworks—dating from the Neolithic to the Iron Age—including this passage tomb (the "Mound of the Hostages")

images.title: View north from the Royal Enclosure towards the Mound of the Hostages by Eric Jones, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: View north from the Royal Enclosure towards the Mound of the Hostages. The Hill of Tara was included in the World Monuments Fund's 2008 Watch List of the 100 Most Endangered Sites in the world

images.title: Tree lined road approaching the Hill of Tara by Eric Jones, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Tree lined road approaching the Hill of Tara

images.title: Patrick Brown, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Nice views of the countryside

images.title: Uppa66, CC BY-SA 4.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: County Meath

description: This walk visits a fascinating ancient site near Skryne in County Meath. The atmospheric area was once used as the inauguration place and seat of the High Kings of Ireland. The site also has strong associations with Irish mythology and has uncovered many archaeological gems over the years. You can start the walk from the parking area just to the north of the site. Then follow footpaths south past St Patrick's Parish Church to the Rath of the Synods and the Mound of Hostages. Here you can explore the ancient ceremonial and burial sites which are considered to be some of the most significant archaeological sites in Ireland. From the hill there are also excellent views over the surrounding countryside. The Hill Of Tara is located about 43km north west of Dublin, so should take just under an hour in the car.
